result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Restitution is set at ZERO.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*1/19/2016  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

superMiscConds.notes: NO CONTACT with victim, Sharon W.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Dwayne Lofton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 1/19/2016: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or the Substance Abuse Program.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify eligibility for early release programs.

Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by parties; additional statement by Sharon W.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 38 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 198 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 20 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-NO CONTACT with victim, Sharon W.
Restitution is set at ZERO.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed by defense  letters to the court as to AODA

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is in trial today and sentencing is adjourned to 10-29-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
AS to count 2:  Court orders count dismissed and read in.
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 10-6-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Atty Kevin Gaertner contacts the court to request a plea date of 8-27-2015 at 8:15am.  Defendant at HOC and must be produced. State is advised of date by defense counsel.
received and filed.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is now requesting that case be scheduled for a Jury Trial.  State withdraws current officer.  Motions in Limine filed by the State, regarding admission of the 911 call.  Court would address motion on the date of trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-12-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Upon the request of the Court, the Plea and Sentencing Hearing scheduled on 6-26-2015 is moved from the pm calendar to the am calendar.  Case now adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   ADA Heitman and Attorney Gaertner were both advised of the change in time for the Sentencing Hearing on 6-26-2015.   mld
addressed to the court from defendant, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court, defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Additional discovery needed by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.

Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sharon W

Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dennis Dwayne Lofton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
